SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

org.acra.annotation
Annotation Type ReportsCrashes

@Documented
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface ReportsCrashes

Provide configuration elemets to the ACRA#init(android.app.Application) method. The only mandatory configuration item is the formKey() parameter which is the Id of your Google Documents form which will receive reports.

Author:
Kevin Gaudin

Required Element Summary
 String formKey
          The id of the Google Doc form.
 
Optional Element Summary
 String[] additionalDropBoxTags
          You can provide here a list of tags that will be fetched when collecting DropBox entries.
 boolean deleteUnapprovedReportsOnApplicationStart
          Controls wether unapproved reports are deleted on application start or not.
 int dropboxCollectionMinutes
          How many minutes will be looked back when collecting events from DropBoxManager.
 String formUri
          The Uri of your own server-side script that will receive reports.
 String formUriBasicAuthLogin
          When using the formUri() parameter to send reports to a custom server-side script, you can set here and in formUriBasicAuthPassword() the credentials for a BASIC HTTP authentication.
 String formUriBasicAuthPassword
          When using the formUri() parameter to send reports to a custom server-side script, you can set here and in formUriBasicAuthLogin() the credentials for a BASIC HTTP authentication.
 boolean includeEventsLogcat
          Include logcat events from the eventslog (logcat -b event).
 boolean includeRadioLogcat
          Inlude logcat events from the radio log (logcat -b radio).
 String[] logcatArguments
           Arguments to be passed to the logcat command line.
 ReportField[] mailReportFields
          You can set here the list of ReportFields you want to send in your email reports mailTo().
 String mailTo
          Add your crash reports mailbox here if you want to send reports via email.
 ReportingInteractionMode mode
           The interaction mode you want to implement.
 int resDialogCommentPrompt
          Resource id for the user comment input label in the crash dialog.
 int resDialogIcon
          Resource id for the icon in the crash dialog.
 int resDialogOkToast
          Resource id for the Toast text triggered when the user accepts to send a report in the crash dialog.
 int resDialogText
          Resource id for the text in the crash dialog.
 int resDialogTitle
          Resource id for the title in the crash dialog.
 int resNotifIcon
          Resource id for the icon in the status bar notification.
 int resNotifText
          Resource id for the text in the status bar notification.
 int resNotifTickerText
          Resource id for the ticker text in the status bar notification.
 int resNotifTitle
          Resource id for the title in the status bar notification.
 int resToastText
          Resource id for the Toast text triggered when the application crashes if the notification+dialog mode is not used.
 int sharedPreferencesMode
          If using a custom sharedPreferencesName(), pass here the mode that you need for the SharedPreference file creation: Context#MODE_PRIVATE, Context#MODE_WORLD_READABLE or Context#MODE_WORLD_WRITEABLE.
 String sharedPreferencesName
          Name of the SharedPreferences that will host the ACRA.PREF_DISABLE_ACRA or ACRA.PREF_ENABLE_ACRA preference.
 

Element Detail

formKey

public abstract String formKey
The id of the Google Doc form.

Returns:

formUri

public abstract String formUri
The Uri of your own server-side script that will receive reports. This is to use if you don't want to send reports to Google Docs but to your own script.

Returns:
Default:
""

mode

public abstract ReportingInteractionMode mode

The interaction mode you want to implement. Default is ReportingInteractionMode.SILENT which does not require any resources configuration.

Other modes have resources requirements:

  • ReportingInteractionMode.TOAST requires resToastText() to be provided to define the text that you want to be displayed to the user when a report is being sent.
  • ReportingInteractionMode.NOTIFICATION requires resNotifTickerText(), resNotifTitle(), resNotifText(), resDialogText()

Returns:
Default:
org.acra.ReportingInteractionMode.SILENT

resDialogCommentPrompt

public abstract int resDialogCommentPrompt
Resource id for the user comment input label in the crash dialog. If not provided, disables the input field.

Default:
0

resDialogIcon

public abstract int resDialogIcon
Resource id for the icon in the crash dialog.

Default:

public abstract int resDialogOkToast
Resource id for the Toast text triggered when the user accepts to send a report in the crash dialog.

Default:
0

public abstract int resDialogText
Resource id for the text in the crash dialog.

Default:
0

resDialogTitle

public abstract int resDialogTitle
Resource id for the title in the crash dialog.

Default:
0

Resource id for the icon in the status bar notification.

public abstract int resNotifText
Resource id for the text in the status bar notification.

Resource id for the title in the status bar notification.

resToastText

public abstract int resToastText
Resource id for the Toast text triggered when the application crashes if the notification+dialog mode is not used.

Default:

sharedPreferencesName

public abstract String sharedPreferencesName
Name of the SharedPreferences that will host the ACRA.PREF_DISABLE_ACRA or ACRA.PREF_ENABLE_ACRA preference. Default is to use the default SharedPreferences, as retrieved with PreferenceManager#getDefaultSharedPreferences(Context).

Default:
""

sharedPreferencesMode

public abstract int sharedPreferencesMode
If using a custom sharedPreferencesName(), pass here the mode that you need for the SharedPreference file creation: Context#MODE_PRIVATE, Context#MODE_WORLD_READABLE or Context#MODE_WORLD_WRITEABLE. Default is Context#MODE_PRIVATE.

See Also:
Context#getSharedPreferences(String, int)
Default:

additionalDropBoxTags

public abstract String[] additionalDropBoxTags
You can provide here a list of tags that will be fetched when collecting DropBox entries.

Default:
{}

dropboxCollectionMinutes

public abstract int dropboxCollectionMinutes
How many minutes will be looked back when collecting events from DropBoxManager.

Default:
5

logcatArguments

public abstract String[] logcatArguments

Arguments to be passed to the logcat command line. Default is { "-t", "200", "-v", "time" } for: 

 logcat -t 200 -v time

Do not include -b arguments for buffer selection, use includeEventsLogcat() and includeRadioLogcat() to activate alternative logcat buffers reporting. They will use the same other arguments as those provided here.

See Listing of logcat Command Options.

Default:
{"-t", "200", "-v", "time"}

includeRadioLogcat

public abstract boolean includeRadioLogcat
Inlude logcat events from the radio log (logcat -b radio).

Default:
false

includeEventsLogcat

public abstract boolean includeEventsLogcat
Include logcat events from the eventslog (logcat -b event).

Default:
false

formUriBasicAuthLogin

public abstract String formUriBasicAuthLogin
When using the formUri() parameter to send reports to a custom server-side script, you can set here and in formUriBasicAuthPassword() the credentials for a BASIC HTTP authentication.

Default:
"ACRA-NULL-STRING"

formUriBasicAuthPassword

public abstract String formUriBasicAuthPassword
When using the formUri() parameter to send reports to a custom server-side script, you can set here and in formUriBasicAuthLogin() the credentials for a BASIC HTTP authentication.

Default:
"ACRA-NULL-STRING"

mailTo

public abstract String mailTo
Add your crash reports mailbox here if you want to send reports via email. This allows to get rid of the INTERNET permission.

Default:
""

mailReportFields

public abstract ReportField[] mailReportFields
You can set here the list of ReportFields you want to send in your email reports mailTo(). Default is: ReportField.USER_COMMENT, ReportField.ANDROID_VERSION, ReportField.APP_VERSION_NAME, ReportField.BRAND, ReportField.PHONE_MODEL, ReportField.CUSTOM_DATA, ReportField.STACK_TRACE

Default:
{org.acra.ReportField.USER_COMMENT, org.acra.ReportField.ANDROID_VERSION, org.acra.ReportField.APP_VERSION_NAME, org.acra.ReportField.BRAND, org.acra.ReportField.PHONE_MODEL, org.acra.ReportField.CUSTOM_DATA, org.acra.ReportField.STACK_TRACE}

deleteUnapprovedReportsOnApplicationStart

public abstract boolean deleteUnapprovedReportsOnApplicationStart
Controls wether unapproved reports are deleted on application start or not. Default is true. This is a change from versions of ACRA before 3.2 as in NOTIFICATION mode reports were previously kept until the user explicitly opens the Notification dialog AND choose to send or discard the report. Unitl then, on application restart, ACRA was issuing a new crash notification for previous reports pending for approval. This could be misunderstood by the user with a new crash, resulting in bad appreciation of the application.

Default:
true
